round_best: Develop a reinforcement learning-based framework for hard-label attacks in black-box settings, where an intelligent agent learns an optimal policy for perturbing an image through a series of actions, each representing a potential modification to the image. The agent receives a reward based on the effectiveness of the attack (i.e., whether the perturbed image changes the top-1 predicted label while minimizing detectability and the number of queries). This method uses the agent's ability to learn from sparse rewards and explore more efficient pathways to successful adversarial examples, potentially reducing the query count and increasing the overall efficiency of the attack process.

round_best: Integrate Bayesian optimization techniques into the reinforcement learning framework for hard-label attacks to better navigate the search space with fewer queries.
